item.title: The year of the linux desktop is here, old man!
item.description: For a very long time, I thought I was bad at making choices. Not the big dramatic life choices... but the ones like choosing an operating system. I say this because I spent an unreasonable amount of time deciding between operating systems that, on paper, all do the same thing. In reality, though, they follow very different philosophies. item.title: I imagined a WhatsApp message across the world
item.description: I had too much free time the other day (always dangerous), so instead of doing something useful, I got curious about what actually happens when I send a WhatsApp message from Bangalore to someone in San Francisco. Just a simple "Hi". So I tried to trace the journey. I made some assumptions along the way, but hey, the whole internet is basically built on assumptions anyway. item.title: That's it. I'm done with smartwatches!
item.description: As a kid, I loved watches. I didn’t own many. Actually, I didn’t own any at all until 8th grade, when my grandmother gifted me my first one. It was a Titan Zoop. One of those kids' analog quartz watches. Small dial. Light blue strap. Thin enough to disappear on my wrist. There was also a darker blue back strap for “support”, though I never quite understood what exactly it was supporting. I hated wearing it. It looked delicate. Almost decorative.
